Test steps: Verify that the documentation describes how to install the application both in a physical and in a virtual environment
Verify that the system documentation describes the databases and database versions used.
Verify that the solution description details how encryption keys are managed
Verify that all relevant information is logged in the security log
Verify that the meter is protected against intrusion. Verify that the meter is protected against tampering. Verify that the meter is protected against malware execution

Purpose: Switching on and off and status of breakers from other GE system
Test steps: Verify that switching on is not possible by integration from other system. Verify that switching off is not possible by integration from other system. Verify that status of switches is possible to see by integration.
Receive same info from file. Receive same info from meter
Wait for 45 minutes.
Kamstrup demonstrates how components can be traced to batch and time of manufacture

Purpose: Function of the metering unit after loss of phases on Cat1
Test steps: Remove voltage on two of three phases

Purpose: Function of the metering unit after phase loss on Cat2
Test steps: Remove voltage on two of three phases
Run the export of data.
For example, turn off the connection between Collection Manager and OMNIA Flex.
The Contractor shall establish a test report for the test phases for which the Contractor is responsible during the Delivery Project, as shown in Figure 1 in clause 3.2.

The supplier shall also report possible consequences and impact on other functions from modifications made. The purchaser has the right to require repetition of the tests made in FAT if such modifications are made.
The purchaser's UAT (User Acceptance Test) shall include testing and verification of all requirements of the Specification unless otherwise agreed.

Purpose: Requirements for delivery and installation in the production environment
Test steps:
The Supplier shall during installation and commissioning of the Metering System in the Customer's production environment:
-install,
-if applicable configure/parameterize,
-if applicable migrate structure data,
-commission,
-verify and test the Metering System including integrations in the production environment, and 
-perform error corrections and retests

Verify that it is possible to install new Metering Unit - Cat 1, 1 phase. Verify that it is possible to install new Metering Unit - Cat 1, 3 phase. Verify that it is possible to install new Metering Unit - Cat 2. Replace meter type Cat 1, 1 phase. Replace meter type Cat 1, 3 phase. Replace meter type Cat 2. Take down meter type Cat 1, 1 phase. Take down meter type Cat 1, 3 phase. Take down meter type Cat 2

Verify that structure data can be handled in HES (e.g. Facility ID, Metering Unit). Verify that Metrics can be handled in HES (Metrics with e.g. ID number, status, timestamp). Verify that Events can be handled in HES (Event with e.g. Event ID, times, Alarms)
Verify that the retrieved measurement and structural data as well as the finished reports can be exported to any standardized text file format, such as csv.

Purpose: Energy values to other system within 10 sec
Test steps: Verify that the goods are delivered from HES according to the agreed export interval
Verify that there is functionality to select different time intervals and time resolution for the Metrics presented.
Verify that there is a help function in the HES user interface that helps the User to understand how to perform tasks using the functionality of the system.

Purpose: Filtering and sorting in alarm list
Test steps: Verify that a User has the ability to filter and sort in the alarm list.

Purpose: View last measurement value and time
Test steps: Verify that the last Measured Value and the time of communication with the Metering Unit are displayed in HES. Verify that the last Measured Value and the time of communication with the Metering Unit are displayed in the HES.

Purpose: Customer interface is disabled by default
Test steps: Verify that on delivery from the factory, the Customer Interface of the Metering Unit is deactivated.
Verify that it is possible to copy static fields in HES such as headers, status, responses to Events in the system.

Verify that commands, initiated by the User in HES, which may have serious consequences in case of incorrect handling (deletion of stored measurement and structure data and switching off and on of power) require additional confirmation before being executed. Verify that commands which do not have serious consequences do not require additional confirmation before being executed.
Verify that in HES there is a function to perform mass deletion of overall structure data objects so that all linked relations are also deleted. E.g. that this is implemented via group membership.
Verify that configuration of the Metering Device from HES can be performed without downloading new Firmware.

Verify that groups can be created dynamically by the User in HES using different parameters, e.g. Facility ID for export of collected data or meter software upgrade where group can be by postcode or meter identity.
Verify that the metering device corrects the measured values of voltage and/or current when calculating energy consumption, these values shall also be those used in the Metering System.

Purpose: Record when high power exceeds limit value per phase
Test steps:
Verify that the Metering System is able to record and store information when the following Events occur:
14. High power exceeds set limit value per phase

Purpose: Record when power output exceeds limit value
Test steps:
Verify that the Metering System is able to record and store information when the following Events occur:
15. Total power consumption exceeds set limit value

Purpose: Disable sending of Events from specific Metering Unit
Test steps: Verify that it is possible to disable the sending of Events from the designated Metering Unit from HES in order not to have to receive a large amount of Events from a particular Metering Unit.
Verify that it is possible to view the communication status of the Metering Unit directly, without manual intervention and without opening the meter.
Verify that it is possible to view the communication status of the Metering Unit directly, without manual intervention and without opening the meter.
Verify that it is possible to view the communication status of the Metering Unit directly, without manual intervention and without opening the meter.

Purpose: Response times in the user interface
Test steps:
Verify that HES user interface response times do not exceed:
- 0.5 s from input, keystroke or equivalent to first response on screen
- 0.5 s for display of form view including data
- 5 s for viewing simple report
- 15 s for login

For Cat1 - 1 phase meters, verify that the Meter breaker can be blocked from HES to prevent local connection. For Cat1 - 3 phase meters, verify that the Meter breaker can be blocked from HES to prevent local connection. For Cat2 meters, verify that the Meter breaker cannot be blocked from HES to prevent local connection.
Verify that the Extended Type Approval and Certification of Metering Units is carried out according to method SPM 1618, test with 12 kV surge voltage.
Verify that the Extended Type Approval and Certification of Metering Units is carried out according to method SPM 1618, test with 12 kV surge voltage.

Purpose: Management of both primary and secondary registration - Cat2
Test steps: Verify that the Metering Units can handle primary registration of Measured Values. Verify that the Metering Units can handle secondary registration of Measured Values.

Purpose: Cat 2 shall meet the requirements for control
Test steps: Verify that Metering Units Category 2 meet the requirements for Inspection, according to Regulation STAFS 2009:8, for the first Inspection. However, only for a maximum of 12 years after Final Approval has been given by the Client.
Verify that the Metering Unit has terminal covers that cover the connection cable layer.
Verify that the Metering Unit has terminal covers that cover the connection cable layer.
Verify that there are no elevations around the Metering Unit's screw attachments that limit the size of the screw head.
Verify that there are no elevations around the Metering Unit's screw attachments that limit the size of the screw head.
Verify that there is a mounting bracket placed on the top of the metering unit for mounting.
Verify that there is a mounting bracket placed on the top of the metering unit for mounting.
Verify that the sealing device of the Metering Unit is raised and clearly visible for smooth and accessible passage of the sealing wire.
Verify that the sealing device of the Metering Unit is raised and clearly visible for smooth and accessible passage of the sealing wire.

Purpose: Management of both primary and secondary registration - Cat1
Test steps: Verify that the Metering Units can handle both primary and secondary recording of Metering Values.
Verify that the licensed telecommunications network complies with Ordinances and Regulations in accordance with PTSFS 2015:2 issued by PTS (Post- och Telestyrelsen).

Purpose: Quantity of allowed faulty meters Cat1 - RISE
Test steps: During the expected lifetime of the Metering Units, the occurrence of faults (requiring meter replacement) shall not exceed 0.75 % per year of the installed volume.

Purpose: Amount of allowed faulty meters Cat2 - RISE
Test steps: During the expected lifetime of the Metering Units, the occurrence of faults (requiring meter replacement) shall not exceed 0.75 % per year of the installed volume.

Purpose: Recovery time after communication breakdown max 60 min
Test steps: Break the communication link from meter. Voltage is left in meter. Wait one hour and turn on the link again.
Wait until the time for export occurs.
Start an export from HES.

Purpose: Installation of new metering device via integration
Test steps: Information regarding structure data for new set-up is sent from the integration interface Mint to Collection Manager. Verify that information entered on the user point in Collection Manager corresponds to what is specified in the Work Order. An acknowledgment is sent to Generis that the meter is set up in Collection Manager. Check that the user point is displayed under the correct coordinates in the map view in Vision. Check that the meter has the correct profile and that Energy values. PQ values and GSM diagnostics are pushed from the meter at the correct interval.

Purpose: Dismantling of metering unit via integration
Test steps: Information regarding the structure data for the removal of a metering unit is sent from the integration interface Mint to Collection Manager. Verify that the metering unit is removed in Collection Manager and does not have a connection to the user point.

Purpose: Update of measurement point in CM
Test steps: Information regarding the structure data for updating a metering unit is sent from the integration interface Mint to Collection Manager. Verify that the information to be updated via Mint has also been changed at the current user point.

Purpose: New Metering Unit is set up in CM and taken down in ACM - Take down fails in ACM
Test steps: Initiate a new set-up of a metering unit in CM and ensure that the metering unit is still in ACM when the new set-up is carried out in CM. A message is sent from CM to Generis stating that the metering unit in ACM is not taken down.

Purpose: New Metering Unit is set up in CM and taken down in AiMiR - Take down fails in AiMiR
Test steps: Initiate a new set-up of a metering unit in CM and ensure that the metering unit remains in AiMiR when the new set-up is carried out in CM. Mail is sent to the AiMir box.

Purpose: New Metering Unit is set up in CM and taken down in ACM - Set-up fails in CM
Test steps: Initiate a new set-up of a metering unit in CM and make sure that the metering unit is already connected to another facility in CM. Message is sent from CM to Generis stating that the metering unit is not created in CM.

Purpose: New Metering Unit is set up in CM and taken down in AiMiR - Set-up fails in CM
Test steps: Initiate a new set-up of a metering unit in CM and ensure that the metering unit is still in AiMir when the new set-up is carried out in CM. A message is sent from CM to Generis stating that the metering unit has not been created in CM.

Purpose: Existing Metering Unit is changed in CM - Meter change fails in CM
Test steps: Initiate a meter change of an existing metering unit in CM to a New Metering Unit. Enter incorrect serial number for the existing meter in the Work Order. Message is sent from CM to Generis stating that the metering unit is not created in CM. Verify the status of the work order in Generis.

Purpose: New metering unit set up in CM - Set up fails in CM
Test steps: Initiate new installation of a metering unit in CM. Enter a serial number for the metering unit already connected to an installation in the work order. Message is sent from CM to Generis stating that the metering unit is not created in CM. Verify the status of the work order in Generis.

Purpose: Metering unit is taken down in CM - Take-down fails in CM
Test steps: Initiate a removal of a metering unit in CM where mandatory information in the work order is not complete. Message is sent from CM to Generis stating that the metering unit is not removed in CM. Verify the status of the work order in Generis.
HES shall be designed to be used with different types of computers, tablets and smart phones, with different architectures and operating systems.
Examine the content of the messages from HES.
